page.title: 09Local History in Chorley (1)
page.content: Astley Hall (1) This mansion was presented to the town of Chorley by Reginald A.Tatton of Cuerden. The original hall was an Elizabethan half timbered structure grouped around a central court and dating from about 1580. In 1666 extensive rebuilding was carried out, the front part of the hall was pulled down and rebuilt on a more lavish scale in the Jacobean style.At the same time a long gallery was added. The hall contains a unique collection of furniture, including two items worthy of special mention. One is the very fine Elizabethan bed, known locally as the Cromwell bed (Oliver Cromwell is supposed to have slept in it) .The other is the famous shovel board table in the Long Gallery.
